greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Row index to A255545: If n is k-th Lucky number then a(n) = k, otherwise a(n) = number of the stage where n is removed in Lucky sieve.
comment: For n >= 2 this works also as a row index to array A255551 (which does not contain 1) and when restricted to unlucky numbers, A050505, also as a row index to array A255543.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10003
formula: a(2n) = 1. [All even numbers are removed at the stage one of the sieve.]
program: (define (A260438 n) (cond ((not (zero? (A145649 n))) (A109497 n)) ((even? n) 1) (else (let searchrow ((row 2)) (let searchcol ((col 1)) (cond ((>= (A255543bi row col) n) (if (= (A255543bi row col) n) row (searchrow (+ 1 row)))) (else (searchcol (+ 1 col))))))))) ;; Code for A255543bi given in A255543.
xref: Cf. also A260429, A260439 (corresponding column indices).
Cf. A055396, A260738 for row indices to other arrays similar to A255545.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 29 2015
